perturbation.original_text: 1.17 "Commercialization" or "Commercialize" means activities taken before and after obtaining Regulatory Approval relating specifically to the pre-launch, launch, promotion, marketing, sales force recruitment, sale and distribution of a pharmaceutical product and post-launch medical activities, including without limitation: (a) distribution for commercial sale; (b) strategic marketing, sales force Detailing, advertising, and market and product support; (c) medical education and liaison and any Phase IV Clinical Trials, to the extent permitted by this Agreement; (d) all customer support and product distribution, invoicing and sales activities; and (e) all post-approval regulatory activities, including those necessary to maintain Regulatory Approvals.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.17 "Commercialization" or "Go-to-Market strategy" means activities taken before and after obtaining Regulatory Approval relating specifically to the pre-launch, launch, promotion, marketing, sales force recruitment, sale and distribution of a pharmaceutical product and post-launch medical activities, including without limitation: (a) distribution for commercial sale; (b) strategic marketing, sales force Detailing, advertising, and market and product support; (c) medical education and liaison and any Phase IV Clinical Trials, to the extent permitted by this Agreement; (d) all customer support and product distribution, invoicing and sales activities; and (e) all post-approval regulatory activities, including those necessary to maintain Regulatory Approvals.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced the term 'Commercialize' with 'Go-to-Market strategy' without proper definition. This creates a potential ambiguity, as 'Go-to-Market strategy' may not be interpreted as precisely as 'Commercialization,' potentially leading to disputes about the scope of the obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Overview. Green Cross shall have full responsibility and authority for all aspects of the Commercialization of Products in the Territory at its sole expense, including, without limitation, developing and executing a plan for commercial launch, obtaining all required approvals from Regulatory Authorities for Commercialization (including, without limitation, reimbursement activities), marketing and promotion, booking sales and distribution and performance of related services, providing customer support, including handling medical queries, and performing other related functions. Green Cross shall use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to Commercialize the Products. Green Cross shall update MacroGenics regarding its Commercialization activities at regular meetings of the JSC as contemplated by Section 2.1.(e). As between Green Cross and MacroGenics, ***. Green Cross shall bear all of the costs and expenses incurred in connection with all such Commercialization activities in the Territory. Green Cross shall timely notify MacroGenics as to the occurrence of the First Commercial Sale in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Overview. Green Cross shall have full responsibility and authority for all aspects of the Go-To-Market strategy of Products in the Territory at its sole expense, including, without limitation, developing and executing a plan for commercial launch, obtaining all required approvals from Regulatory Authorities for Marketing (including, without limitation, reimbursement activities), marketing and promotion, booking sales and distribution and performance of related services, providing customer support, including handling medical queries, and performing other related functions. Green Cross shall use Best Efforts to Market the Products. Green Cross shall update MacroGenics regarding its Marketing activities at regular meetings of the JSC as contemplated by Section 2.1.(e). As between Green Cross and MacroGenics, ***. Green Cross shall bear all of the costs and expenses incurred in connection with all such Marketing activities in the Territory. Green Cross shall timely notify MacroGenics as to the occurrence of the First Commercial Sale in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: Using terms 'Go-To-Market strategy' and 'Marketing' interchangeably creates contradictions to its preceding section. Also by alternating, Commercially Reasonable Efforts and Best Efforts, which introduces potential uncertainty in the performance standards expected of Green Cross in these activities.

perturbation.original_text: Green Cross shall update MacroGenics regarding its Commercialization activities at regular meetings of the JSC as contemplated by Section 2.1.(e). As between Green Cross and MacroGenics, ***. Green Cross shall bear all of the costs and expenses incurred in connection with all such Commercialization activities in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: Green Cross shall update MacroGenics regarding its Marketing initiatives at regular meetings of the JSC as contemplated by Section 2.1.(e). As between Green Cross and MacroGenics, ***. Green Cross shall bear all of the costs and expenses incurred in connection with all such Sales efforts in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Commercialization activities' with 'Marketing initiatives' and 'Commercialization activities' with 'Sales efforts'. This can cause confusion because those terms have already been modified differently in the section above, making this statement contradictory and unenforceable. 'Marketing initiatives' and 'Sales efforts' are related but not identical concepts, and their specific scope is not clearly defined.
